name: politico
text:
House Democrats are debating how aggressively to confront Trump’s latest alleged abuses, particularly with just four months before an election in which the president has damaged himself with near-daily errors and seen his standing slide in national polls

https://t.co/oh6Gzd8It5

name: politico
text:
Welcome to an action-packed primary day, even though it’s likely we won’t know the winners of some of the most closely-watched races tonight.

Join our live chat for real-time analysis and updates from our reporters
https://t.co/Ueun9J2BB1

name: politico
text:
Early signs show Kentucky Rep. Charles Booker is doing really well even in some of the rural counties that are releasing in-person voting totals today, says @JamesArkin. 

It underscores the momentum he built in the closing weeks of the campaign
https://t.co/Ueun9J2BB1

name: politico
text:
After a disappointing showing at his campaign rally over the weekend, Trump renewed his performance for a packed crowd of students today, telling his Arizona audience that they were guardians in a cultural war over the heritage of the country

https://t.co/Qgtp7Zx1uM

name: politico
text:
Spotted in @politicocharlie’s 1990 copy of the Almanacs of American Politics: Rep. Eliot Engel.

His time in Congress (some 30 years) is something progressives have used to label him as out of touch, says @lbarronlopez.  https://t.co/zYx4z1UrWi https://t.co/Q9vhjQavd6

name: politico
text:
Kentucky update: With 46% of precincts reporting (keep in mind these figures do not include absentee ballots) Amy McGrath leads Charles Booker 45.5% - 35.2% 

More results: https://t.co/Cnwhn9l2xH https://t.co/aS3SND1i09

name: politico
text: https://t.co/Xm8t4afSff

name: politico
text: Who will be Joe Biden's VP pick? A lot of names have been thrown out, but all signs point to one lawmaker at the to… https://t.co/WZvCMVQaXD

name: politico
text:
The decisions made in Washington and Beijing will shape the world for decades to come. Get unique insight in this critical relationship with China Watcher. Subscribe now.
https://t.co/3gr9jzzrQ4 https://t.co/EPAeAEKqj9

name: politico
text: A goal of sustainable construction is to design a “net zero” home that can offset its energy use. Expect to see more of this kind of construction in the coming years, led by states like California. https://t.co/UU0l5Nx3eF https://t.co/1nVNPl7QvM

name: politico
text:
One takeaway from tonight primaries: The U.S. is about to undergo a drastic shift toward mail-in voting and election officials are scrambling to prepare for it, says @ZachMontellaro.

More in our election night live chat: https://t.co/bbUQmU1AE3 https://t.co/xALlG2NF6F

name: politico
text:
Trump and his allies have seized on an argument they think will resonate with Americans: They may take our Confederate statues, but they will never take our other dead white men

https://t.co/izZFYhj85s

name: politico
text:
As candidates in New York and Kentucky duked it out during the last heated hours of their Congressional primaries, voters faced a battle of their own: casting their ballots amid a global pandemic

https://t.co/QWQ00sYVbW

name: politico
text:
Trump’s perfect endorsement record in GOP primary elections crashed tonight when his choice for an open seat in Western North Carolina was drubbed by 24-year-old first-time candidate Madison Cawthorn

https://t.co/Wb45rmpWoD

name: politico
text:
Of all the surprises coronavirus has delivered this year, one of the strangest is slower politics. It’s Election Day, and we’re unlikely to know the outcomes in two of the biggest races tonight.

It's possible we may not know the answer for a week
https://t.co/VlSL2A6h2x

name: politico
text:
U.S. coronavirus cases are surging sharply again, thanks to outbreaks spreading across the country's South and West.

Now even some of Trump’s key allies in affected states are breaking with the WH on the state of the pandemic and how best to respond https://t.co/CZhJNQER1y

name: politico
text:
Nancy Pelosi on Wednesday will unveil a centrist health care plan to shore up Obamacare while taking aim at Trump administration policies that critics say undercut the health care law

https://t.co/h1jQFRcNZM

name: politico
text:
The EU's powerful antitrust and Covid-19 bailout enforcer says the EU will push ahead with a regional digital services tax even if the U.S. sticks to its efforts to block a global deal

https://t.co/gb0mjxvvf9

name: politico
text:
Europe is ready for the future. Or at least ready to hold a conference about it. Almost.

Ambassadors representing the EU's member countries are poised to agree on a common position on the Conference on the Future of Europe
https://t.co/4ooGMXYBeG

name: politico
text:
GOP senators on Tuesday distanced themselves from President Trump’s claim that Barack Obama committed “treason.”

“I don’t know what he’s talking about,” said Sen. Lindsey Graham. “I don’t have any evidence to believe he committed treason”
https://t.co/0f481bEFf1

name: politico
text: President Donald Trump’s crackdown on Twitter may have an unintended effect — hampering the marketing of some of his administration’s signature efforts https://t.co/Yoijp3LcH0

name: politico
text: The Chicago mayor is not prepared to align herself with efforts to “defund the police,” nor does she believe it conflicts with her own work to overhaul local law enforcement https://t.co/SmzhGS9GGi

name: politico
text: The biggest races — the Kentucky Senate primary and Rep. Eliot Engel’s bid for survival in New York — were still too close to call Tuesday night https://t.co/2R2g8e3FJc

name: politico
text: In suburban Detroit, a cookout full of Democratic voters bubbles into outrage, frustration at being taken for granted—and certainty that 2020 is in the bag for Trump https://t.co/RVpUxtpa81

name: politico
text: Jacksonville voters don’t want the RNC’s convention to come to town, with most expressing concern that the event could spread the coronavirus https://t.co/oKLReBXm6p

name: politico
text: A majority of American voters now say they’re concerned about sending kids back to elementary and high schools this fall https://t.co/SpggYUWyxo

name: politico
text: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin is exuding confidence about the state of the economy and predicts the U.S. will be out of a recession by year’s end https://t.co/E23Ln3oU8s

name: politico
text: The left roared into yesterday's primaries hoping to unseat at least one entrenched Democratic congressman in NYC and derail the Democratic establishment’s pick to face Mitch McConnell in Kentucky https://t.co/PIZa9eNJRE

name: politico
text: But they’re going to have to wait at least a few more days to find out if they succeeded. Even though last night ended without final calls in many of the biggest primaries, the results showed some incumbents in trouble and major trends shaking both parties https://t.co/PIZa9eNJRE

name: politico
text:
Kentucky is poised for a photo finish.

Amy McGrath has a 8-point lead over Charles Booker right now, but her lead is far from secure. Jefferson and Fayette counties won’t release any vote counts until they’ve also tabulated absentee ballots. https://t.co/PIZa9eNJRE https://t.co/P6SX5oBvmm

name: politico
text: The end is near for Rep. Eliot Engel in N.Y. Unless Engel’s supporters are as obsessive about mail voting as he used to be about snagging an aisle seat for the State of the Union address, his time in the House is over. https://t.co/PIZa9eNJRE https://t.co/6jYKkwyCAI

name: politico
text: The president’s undefeated record in 2020 GOP primary elections came was shattered in N.C. where his pick to succeed former Rep. Mark Meadows in a solidly GOP House district, Lynda Bennett, fell flat, losing by 32 percentage points in a primary runoff https://t.co/PIZa9eNJRE https://t.co/rUVynsdrcB

name: politico
text: Progressives fretted that large Dem. primary fields for 2 open House seats in N.Y. would enable more conservative candidates to take over safe seats. But while neither the 15th nor 17th District was called last night, the left can breathe a little easier https://t.co/PIZa9eNJRE https://t.co/E6kPYfyHvj

name: politico
text: Kentucky and New York aren’t opening their absentee ballots for at least a week, as both states adjust to processing many more mailed-in ballots than usual.  It's an early hint of the change coming to general election night in November. https://t.co/PIZa9eNJRE

name: politico
text: The Senate will take a procedural vote today on the GOP’s police reform bill — but Democrats are preparing to block it https://t.co/A4iH1OyD6L

name: politico
text: Travelers from the U.S. and Brazil could be prevented from entering the EU when the bloc’s external borders are reopened https://t.co/QVUe4iFqi6
